Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We‚Äôre committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That‚Äôs why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: AI/LLM Engineer
Description:
What we do
READ BEFORE APPLYING: Adding a is mandatory for this position. We do this to get a better sense of candidates before continuing the process. Any application without a video will be rejected by default. Find instructions at the bottom of the post. No cover letter is required. Thank you!


At Briink, we're helping accelerate the transition to a sustainable future by creating the next-generation of AI powered tools for sustainability and ESG teams on the frontlines of solving the climate crisis.




We believe that AI is the key to unlocking the future of sustainable business. With over 50 enterprise clients‚Äîincluding some of the world's largest firms‚Äîwe‚Äôre already transforming how organizations manage their ESG data. Our technology helps sustainability teams uncover actionable insights from unstructured data sources, making it easier to drive compliance, efficiency, and impact at scale.




Backed by ‚Ç¨7 million in capital, including a freshly closed round, and supported by leading venture capital funds, Briink is at the forefront of ESG innovation. We‚Äôre based at the heart of Europe‚Äôs AI revolution‚Äîthe AI Campus in Berlin‚Äîwhere we are building a future where AI helps accelerate the transition to a sustainable future.


Your role


As Briink‚Äôs AI/LLM Engineer, you will work as part of the product and engineering team to bring the cutting edge of LLMs to sustainable finance and help advance Briink‚Äôs mission to accelerate transition to a sustainable planet. This includes both using your knowledge and experience as an AI practitioner to evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM engine, as well as exploring new use-cases for LLMs in ESG and sustainability.





Systematically evaluate and improve our core LLM systems: You will use your knowledge and experience as an AI/LLM practitioner to systematically evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM system and help ensure Briink becomes a world leader for ESG domain specific LLM tools.


Build LLMs into production grade services: On a scale with pure researcher on one side and traditional backend software development on the other side, this leans somewhat more on the software engineering side of the scale, as part of your role will also be to help ensure that improvements to the AI/LLM services are driven through to production and delivering tangible value to our users.


Explore new LLM use-cases in ESG: Both LLMs and ESG are moving very fast and so at Briink we value curiosity and exploring how AI could be applied to new use cases in ESG. Part of your role therefore will be to explore and prototype new ways LLMs could support our users and solve new problems for ESG teams.


Be a core member of the product and engineering team: Briink is a collaborative team and we really enjoy working together to try and build Briink into a successful company that has mission impact at scale. You will therefore work closely as part of a cross discipline team to make sure all the work we do pushes in the same direction and helps achieve our mission.



Your profile

What type of person we're looking for...



Knowledgable and experienced with building AI/LLM products: You have strong knowledge and experience of thinking through and building AI/LLM systems from prototyping and experiments through to deployment, evaluation, monitoring and improvement in production.


Practical Implementer: You are a ‚Äòbuilder‚Äô and aim to pragmatically integrate AI into real-world products, moving beyond research to create tangible, impactful solutions.


Personal agency and drive: must have personal agency, drive and ability to figure things out, learn and iterate to drive initiatives forward to success.


Innovative Thinker: You're driven by curiosity and continually experiment with new models, techniques and technologies in the rapidly evolving AI/LLM space.


Excellent Communicator: You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English, and can build strong relationships with internal teams and external partners.


Collaborative and Organised: You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve success. Preferably with experience in start-ups.


Passion for ESG and Sustainability: You are motivated by using your skills to help address climate change and enthusiastic about building tools that help ESG and sustainability teams.



Technical Skills



Minimum of 4 years of experience: As an AI Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, AI/ML Product Engineer or related roles.


Fluency in python: Including strong proficiency with base python as well as modern frameworks (e.g. fastAPI)


Experience with LLMs: Including core concepts around foundation models, prompt engineering and chains etc. as well as preferably some experience with LLM frameworks (e.g. Langchain). Experience using LLMs to build RAG systems and/or other real-world use-cases related to document processing would be a major bonus.


Experience with LLM evaluation: Including how to collect labelled data and systematically evaluate RAG and other real world LLM applications, preferably with experience in evaluation tools and frameworks (e.g. Langsmith)


Experience with production grade applications: Including familiarity with software development tools and practices for production applications (e.g git, CI/CD, containerization) and preferably some experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment (e.g. GCP, Modal). Any experience with cost/latency implications of deploying LLMs at scale would be a major bonus.


Fluency in English: With the ability to clearly communicate complex topics to diverse stakeholders. Any other European language would be a bonus.


Understanding or interest in sustainability: Including an interest in sustainability climate, or ESG topics and a desire to use your skills to help accelerate the climate transition.
Even if your experience doesn‚Äôt align precisely with all the criteria, we encourage you to apply. Many people miss out on opportunities because they feel they don‚Äôt fit every requirement‚Äîwe believe in growth, not perfection!



What we offer



Competitive Remuneration: As a core member of our team, you will receive a competitive salary and equity package, reflecting your role in shaping Briink‚Äôs future.


Purpose-Driven Mission: ESG data has the power to create a more sustainable world, but today it presents more challenges than solutions. We believe AI can change that. Be part of the transition to an AI-powered, sustainable world.


Flexible Working: Our work philosophy is built on flexibility. While we do like to come to the office (in Berlin or London) to collaborate in person, this is a hybrid role with opportunities for some remote work within European time zones.


Trust and Ownership: At Briink, we empower you to own your projects with the option for growing into new roles. We believe in giving people autonomy and trust to drive your own initiatives.


Dynamic Work Environment: Based at the Merantix AI Campus, Berlin‚Äôs hub for AI innovation, you‚Äôll work in a diverse, collaborative environment. With frequent events and opportunities for cross-company collaboration, you‚Äôll be part of a thriving ecosystem of AI startups and experts.


Learning budget and quarterly hackathons: We truly believe in the importance of curiosity and experimentation as both a learning opportunity and strategic advantage. We therefore have a learning budget to explore new technologies and regular hackathons to prototype new ideas.





APPLICATION REQUIREMENT: Intro Video Submission
As part of your application to Briink, please submit a short intro video (maximum of 2 minutes) addressing the following points:





Brief Introduction:



Introduce yourself and summarize your professional background relevant to this role






Passion for building AI/LLMs:



Share what excites you most about this role and why you think you'd be good at it






Alignment with Briink‚Äôs Mission:



Explain why you‚Äôre interested in joining Briink and how our mission resonates with you.
Technical Guidelines:










Duration: The video should not exceed 2 minutes.


Content Quality: We are not assessing video production skills; using a webcam or smartphone is perfectly fine. Focus on clear communication and authenticity.


Format: In the application form, please provide a link to your video hosted on a platform like YouTube (unlisted), Vimeo, Loom, or a shared drive OR upload the video file under "Other" in the Documents section.
Purpose of the Video:


This video helps us get to know you beyond your resume. We‚Äôre interested in your communication skills, your passion, and how you envision contributing to Briink‚Äôs mission and culture.


No cover letter is required!
Where to submit the video:


You can submit the video using this form:


Alternatively you can use the video submission request box and/or file upload feature if this is available on the channel you are applying from

What we do
READ BEFORE APPLYING: Adding a is mandatory for this position. We do this to get a better sense of candidates before continuing the process. Any application without a video will be rejected by default. Find instructions at the bottom of the post. No cover letter is required. Thank you!

At Briink, we're helping accelerate the transition to a sustainable future by creating the next-generation of AI powered tools for sustainability and ESG teams on the frontlines of solving the climate crisis.


We believe that AI is the key to unlocking the future of sustainable business. With over 50 enterprise clients‚Äîincluding some of the world's largest firms‚Äîwe‚Äôre already transforming how organizations manage their ESG data. Our technology helps sustainability teams uncover actionable insights from unstructured data sources, making it easier to drive compliance, efficiency, and impact at scale.


Backed by ‚Ç¨7 million in capital, including a freshly closed round, and supported by leading venture capital funds, Briink is at the forefront of ESG innovation. We‚Äôre based at the heart of Europe‚Äôs AI revolution‚Äîthe AI Campus in Berlin‚Äîwhere we are building a future where AI helps accelerate the transition to a sustainable future.


Your role

As Briink‚Äôs AI/LLM Engineer, you will work as part of the product and engineering team to bring the cutting edge of LLMs to sustainable finance and help advance Briink‚Äôs mission to accelerate transition to a sustainable planet. This includes both using your knowledge and experience as an AI practitioner to evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM engine, as well as exploring new use-cases for LLMs in ESG and sustainability.



  • Systematically evaluate and improve our core LLM systems: You will use your knowledge and experience as an AI/LLM practitioner to systematically evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM system and help ensure Briink becomes a world leader for ESG domain specific LLM tools.

  • Build LLMs into production grade services: On a scale with pure researcher on one side and traditional backend software development on the other side, this leans somewhat more on the software engineering side of the scale, as part of your role will also be to help ensure that improvements to the AI/LLM services are driven through to production and delivering tangible value to our users.

  • Explore new LLM use-cases in ESG: Both LLMs and ESG are moving very fast and so at Briink we value curiosity and exploring how AI could be applied to new use cases in ESG. Part of your role therefore will be to explore and prototype new ways LLMs could support our users and solve new problems for ESG teams.

  • Be a core member of the product and engineering team: Briink is a collaborative team and we really enjoy working together to try and build Briink into a successful company that has mission impact at scale. You will therefore work closely as part of a cross discipline team to make sure all the work we do pushes in the same direction and helps achieve our mission.


Your profile

What type of person we're looking for...

  • Knowledgable and experienced with building AI/LLM products: You have strong knowledge and experience of thinking through and building AI/LLM systems from prototyping and experiments through to deployment, evaluation, monitoring and improvement in production.

  • Practical Implementer: You are a ‚Äòbuilder‚Äô and aim to pragmatically integrate AI into real-world products, moving beyond research to create tangible, impactful solutions.

  • Personal agency and drive: must have personal agency, drive and ability to figure things out, learn and iterate to drive initiatives forward to success.

  • Innovative Thinker: You're driven by curiosity and continually experiment with new models, techniques and technologies in the rapidly evolving AI/LLM space.

  • Excellent Communicator: You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English, and can build strong relationships with internal teams and external partners.

  • Collaborative and Organised: You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve success. Preferably with experience in start-ups.

  • Passion for ESG and Sustainability: You are motivated by using your skills to help address climate change and enthusiastic about building tools that help ESG and sustainability teams.


Technical Skills

  • Minimum of 4 years of experience: As an AI Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, AI/ML Product Engineer or related roles.

  • Fluency in python: Including strong proficiency with base python as well as modern frameworks (e.g. fastAPI)

  • Experience with LLMs: Including core concepts around foundation models, prompt engineering and chains etc. as well as preferably some experience with LLM frameworks (e.g. Langchain). Experience using LLMs to build RAG systems and/or other real-world use-cases related to document processing would be a major bonus.

  • Experience with LLM evaluation: Including how to collect labelled data and systematically evaluate RAG and other real world LLM applications, preferably with experience in evaluation tools and frameworks (e.g. Langsmith)

  • Experience with production grade applications: Including familiarity with software development tools and practices for production applications (e.g git, CI/CD, containerization) and preferably some experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment (e.g. GCP, Modal). Any experience with cost/latency implications of deploying LLMs at scale would be a major bonus.

  • Fluency in English: With the ability to clearly communicate complex topics to diverse stakeholders. Any other European language would be a bonus.

  • Understanding or interest in sustainability: Including an interest in sustainability climate, or ESG topics and a desire to use your skills to help accelerate the climate transition.
    Even if your experience doesn‚Äôt align precisely with all the criteria, we encourage you to apply. Many people miss out on opportunities because they feel they don‚Äôt fit every requirement‚Äîwe believe in growth, not perfection!


What we offer

  • Competitive Remuneration: As a core member of our team, you will receive a competitive salary and equity package, reflecting your role in shaping Briink‚Äôs future.

  • Purpose-Driven Mission: ESG data has the power to create a more sustainable world, but today it presents more challenges than solutions. We believe AI can change that. Be part of the transition to an AI-powered, sustainable world.

  • Flexible Working: Our work philosophy is built on flexibility. While we do like to come to the office (in Berlin or London) to collaborate in person, this is a hybrid role with opportunities for some remote work within European time zones.

  • Trust and Ownership: At Briink, we empower you to own your projects with the option for growing into new roles. We believe in giving people autonomy and trust to drive your own initiatives.

  • Dynamic Work Environment: Based at the Merantix AI Campus, Berlin‚Äôs hub for AI innovation, you‚Äôll work in a diverse, collaborative environment. With frequent events and opportunities for cross-company collaboration, you‚Äôll be part of a thriving ecosystem of AI startups and experts.

  • Learning budget and quarterly hackathons: We truly believe in the importance of curiosity and experimentation as both a learning opportunity and strategic advantage. We therefore have a learning budget to explore new technologies and regular hackathons to prototype new ideas.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - (Logistics, Workforce)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist - (Logistics, Workforce) to join our Logistics team to help us create a fast, reliable and transparent delivery experience. You will make an impact in optimizing our on-demand last-mile delivery operations, involving hundreds of thousands of couriers and restaurants, improving the experience for millions orders per day in 70+ countries.


Conceptualize the right modeling approach for challenges in the field of Logistics at scale, together with your squad lead and our stakeholders.
Innovate new modeling solutions by drawing from fields like Machine Learning, Operations Research and Statistics that drive value for our business.
Pair-program with your squad to engineer solutions that automate the retraining of models and generation of predictions.
Provide ideas in brainstorming sessions with your Data Science colleagues to solve the toughest modeling problems together.
Help defining data needs to bring value to the projects and collaborate with the data engineering as well as with the tech teams in planning their roadmap.
Work with (semi-)structured data from our BigQuery DWH architecture and process with Spark where necessary.
Contribute and make an impact in a global, fast-moving tech organization.
Have fun and grow together with your team.


In our Logistics Team, you‚Äôll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

What you need to be successful


You have at least 3 years of experience applying methods from machine learning to real-world datasets.
Fluency in Python and familiarity with its scientific/visualization libraries such as Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib, Plotly etc.
You can transfer business problems from a problem space to a technical solution space.
Experience in solving regression and classification type of problems with statistical, linear/non-linear models and ensemble models in particular (Random Forest/XGBoost/LightGBM/CatBoost).
Experience with Time-Series Forecasting, Operations Research, and Statistics is an interesting addition.
You know how to work with Big Data platforms such as Big Query/Spark and know how to write a SQL query to pull the data you need.
You can write maintainable code that follows best practices in software engineering.
Before starting to work on a use-case, you carefully challenge existing assumptions and care about clean data.
You are a strong communicator and can explain the intuition behind your modeling approach to people with different backgrounds.
You love to learn and you are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from different tech teams in a diverse environment.


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Science Manager
Description:
Interested in leading data-driven innovation while working in a collaborative, high-impact environment? Passionate about machine learning, big data, and predictive modeling?




We‚Äôve partnered with a fast-growing tech company that is looking for a highly experienced Data Scientist to drive data strategy, machine learning implementation, and data product development across the org. This role offers the opportunity to work on large-scale data solutions, mentor a growing team, and establish best practices in data science and analytics.




What You‚Äôll Be Working On:

Driving data science and analytics strategy, fostering collaboration and best practices across the Data chapter
Improving existing data analysis and reporting structures
Designing and optimizing data pipelines with tools like Apache Airflow, DAGster, and DBT
Working with large datasets to enhance product performance and decision-making
Establishing best practices for cost-effective, scalable data solutions
Mentoring and guiding data analysts and scientists within the organization




Ideal Experience:

Proven industry experience in big data, data warehousing, and data products
Relevant background in LLMs, NLP, and predictive modeling (preferred)
Hands-on experience with SQL, Python, Spark, DuckDB, Snowflake, and Metabase
Expertise in building scalable data pipelines and working with large datasets
Knowledge of servant leadership principles in autonomous product team environments




Other Important Details:

Hybrid role based in Berlin
Competitive salary and benefits package
30 vacation days & remote work flexibility
Company pension, wellness programs, and professional development opportunities




This is an opportunity to lead and shape the future of data science within a forward-thinking company. If you're interested or want to know more, click Apply or reach out to Ionut Roghina for more details.

Title: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER
Description:
BE A PART OF OUR R&D TEAM IN THE HEART OF TECHNOLOGY CENTER




We are looking for young and innovative Software & Hardware
Engineers in Berlin Germany to work with our R&D team to advance our products and solutions for machine vision, robotics, autonomous systems and industrial automation applications.


Tasks


Responsibilities




‚Ä¢ Design, control, and implement advanced systems and products for automation and robotic applications




‚Ä¢ Develop manufacturing processes according to global engineering standards




‚Ä¢ Collaborate with other R&D engineers and technicians to design and to implement




‚Ä¢ Summarize data and report on research, development and test results




‚Ä¢ Examine requirements in product development projects




‚Ä¢ Monitor maintenance and inspection plans




‚Ä¢ Develop product designs for embedded systems and automation applications


Requirements


Requirements




‚Ä¢ Engineering Degree (Computer Science or Mechanical or Electrical or Physics)




‚Ä¢ Architecture design (Software or Mechanical or Electrical) skills




‚Ä¢ Proven expertise as a Research and Development engineer




‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience using design and calculation software




‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of physics in mechanical and electrical applications




‚Ä¢ Understanding of mechanical and electrical engineering for product standards




‚Ä¢ Good knowledge in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering fields is a plus.




‚Ä¢ Advanced problem-solving abilities




‚Ä¢ Attention to detail




‚Ä¢ Strong organizational and communication skills




To apply, please send your application including CV, certificates and degrees.

Title: (Senior) AI Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
What Do You Actually Do As A...


AI Engineer? You turn ideas into intelligent products and solutions. From first spark to final delivery, you drive AI-powered projects end-to-end. You design and develop machine learning models and algorithms that don‚Äôt just function‚Äîthey make a real impact: enabling our customers and service teams to work smarter and faster.


In close collaboration with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers, you translate complex requirements into reliable, scalable AI systems. You stay on top of the latest trends and research in the AI world and bring fresh thinking into our solutions.

You‚Äôre not just a coder‚Äîyou‚Äôre a connector. You document your processes and insights, share knowledge with the team, and continuously optimize models for maximum accuracy and efficiency. You‚Äôre hands-on, forward-thinking, and always one step ahead‚Äîwhether in meetings, in code, or in production.

Your Benefits


Get the opportunity to take on responsibility and your own projects very quickly
A fast-moving, creative team that implements its own ideas with a lot of passion and fun
Combine work and private life through trust-based working hours
30 days vacation per calendar year
Sabbatical (depending on length of service)
Above-average participation in the BAV
Subsidy for the Deutschlandticket or job bike
Dog-friendly office


Your Responsibilities


Ideate and engineer AI-based products and solutions, pushing projects from conception to delivery
Design and develop AI models and algorithms for various applications, including empowering our customers and customer service to be more efficien
Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to define project requirements and deliver high-quality AI solutions
Conduct research to stay updated on the latest advancements in AI and machine learning technologies
Optimize and fine-tune AI models for effectiveness and accuracy
Document processes, methodologies, and results to ensure knowledge sharing within the team


Your Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proven experience in AI and machine learning, with a strong understanding of algorithms and data structures
Proficiency in Python
Experience with AI frameworks and libraries (LangChain, TensorFlow, etc.)
Familiarity with industry-standard AI services
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
You‚Äôve got a few products under your belt already, shipped and used by real customers


About Us

samedi - where tech meets health. This is where the digital transformation of the healthcare system is advanced and shaped.

As one of the leading e-health companies in Europe, we are the bridge between doctors and patients. Our intelligent software solution offers efficient resource planning and online appointment booking with maximum data security. Through our work, we support the relationships between all stakeholders in the healthcare system, enable modern digital forms of treatment and thus significantly improve healthcare.

We want to help people get better faster and give everyone easy and good access to healthcare treatments. We establish digital healthcare services.

You want to work with us?

Send us your application with your intended start date and salary expectations directly via the apply button.

What Awaits You After Your Application


Initial interview with Richard, our Head of Engineering
Second round with our engineering team and some practical tasks
Cultural add with Alex, our Managing Director


For more insights into our corporate culture, follow us on Instagram: samedipeople

Even if you don't meet all the requirements, don't hesitate to apply to us!

At samedi, we value passion, commitment and the willingness to learn new things - and who knows, maybe you are exactly the reinforcement we are looking for.

As a company in the healthcare sector, we work with sensitive (patient) data, so we attach great importance to data protection and information security. This means that we will carry out an identity check during the application process (please have your ID ready for this) and ask you to send us your highest educational qualification certificate. Don't worry - your grades are not important to us. We are primarily interested in getting to know you as a person and meeting the formal requirements for our security concept.

If you have any further questions, please contact Alina by email jobs@samedi.de or by phone on 030 2123 0707 - 807.

***Health knows no boundaries: All personal designations apply equally to all genders ***
Show more
HTML:
What Do You Actually Do As A...

  • AI Engineer? You turn ideas into intelligent products and solutions. From first spark to final delivery, you drive AI-powered projects end-to-end. You design and develop machine learning models and algorithms that don‚Äôt just function‚Äîthey make a real impact: enabling our customers and service teams to work smarter and faster.

In close collaboration with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers, you translate complex requirements into reliable, scalable AI systems. You stay on top of the latest trends and research in the AI world and bring fresh thinking into our solutions.

You‚Äôre not just a coder‚Äîyou‚Äôre a connector. You document your processes and insights, share knowledge with the team, and continuously optimize models for maximum accuracy and efficiency. You‚Äôre hands-on, forward-thinking, and always one step ahead‚Äîwhether in meetings, in code, or in production.

Your Benefits

  • Get the opportunity to take on responsibility and your own projects very quickly
  • A fast-moving, creative team that implements its own ideas with a lot of passion and fun
  • Combine work and private life through trust-based working hours
  • 30 days vacation per calendar year
  • Sabbatical (depending on length of service)
  • Above-average participation in the BAV
  • Subsidy for the Deutschlandticket or job bike
  • Dog-friendly office

Your Responsibilities

  • Ideate and engineer AI-based products and solutions, pushing projects from conception to delivery
  • Design and develop AI models and algorithms for various applications, including empowering our customers and customer service to be more efficien
  • Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to define project requirements and deliver high-quality AI solutions
  • Conduct research to stay updated on the latest advancements in AI and machine learning technologies
  • Optimize and fine-tune AI models for effectiveness and accuracy
  • Document processes, methodologies, and results to ensure knowledge sharing within the team

Your Qualifications

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Proven experience in AI and machine learning, with a strong understanding of algorithms and data structures
  • Proficiency in Python
  • Experience with AI frameworks and libraries (LangChain, TensorFlow, etc.)
  • Familiarity with industry-standard AI services
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
  • You‚Äôve got a few products under your belt already, shipped and used by real customers

About Us

samedi - where tech meets health. This is where the digital transformation of the healthcare system is advanced and shaped.

As one of the leading e-health companies in Europe, we are the bridge between doctors and patients. Our intelligent software solution offers efficient resource planning and online appointment booking with maximum data security. Through our work, we support the relationships between all stakeholders in the healthcare system, enable modern digital forms of treatment and thus significantly improve healthcare.

We want to help people get better faster and give everyone easy and good access to healthcare treatments. We establish digital healthcare services.

You want to work with us?

Send us your application with your intended start date and salary expectations directly via the apply button.

What Awaits You After Your Application

  • Initial interview with Richard, our Head of Engineering
  • Second round with our engineering team and some practical tasks
  • Cultural add with Alex, our Managing Director

For more insights into our corporate culture, follow us on Instagram: samedipeople

Even if you don't meet all the requirements, don't hesitate to apply to us!

At samedi, we value passion, commitment and the willingness to learn new things - and who knows, maybe you are exactly the reinforcement we are looking for.

As a company in the healthcare sector, we work with sensitive (patient) data, so we attach great importance to data protection and information security. This means that we will carry out an identity check during the application process (please have your ID ready for this) and ask you to send us your highest educational qualification certificate. Don't worry - your grades are not important to us. We are primarily interested in getting to know you as a person and meeting the formal requirements for our security concept.

If you have any further questions, please contact Alina by email jobs@samedi.de or by phone on 030 2123 0707 - 807.

***Health knows no boundaries: All personal designations apply equally to all genders ***

Title: Research Engineering Intern
Description:
Deep learning has only just started its transformative impact on the natural sciences. In Microsoft Research AI for Science we are seeking to solve some of the fundamental challenges in the molecular sciences with deep learning.

We are seeking a highly motivated Research Engineering Intern. The ideal candidate will have an understanding of machine learning and/or language modelling fundamentals, and will work on language modelling within the context of natural sciences.

Responsibilities


Architect, design, and implement scalable and robust solutions for machine learning and scientific research involving large volumes of heterogeneous data.
Build and optimize distributed data processing and model building pipelines.
Develop and maintain tools and technologies for building, training, optimizing, scaling machine learning solutions


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications:‚ÄØ‚ÄØ


Working towards a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master's degree or equivalent work experience in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Chemistry, Mathematics or a related field.
Strong familiarity with Linux and the open-source ecosystem
Experience with scientific computing


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience with cloud computing or HPC is a plus
Experience with language modelling is a plus


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Senior ML Engineer - NLP (m/f/d)
Description:
üé§ Why voize? Because we‚Äôre more than just a job!

At voize, we‚Äôre revolutionizing the healthcare industry with AI: Nurses simply speak their documentation into their smartphones, and our AI automatically generates the correct entries. This saves each nurse an average of 39 minutes per day, improves the quality of documentation, and makes their daily work much more rewarding.

voize is YCombinator-funded, already in use at over 600 senior care homes, and has grown by 100% in the last 90 days. Our customers save over 3.5 million hours annually ‚Äì time spent on people instead of paperwork.

But this is just the beginning. With our self-developed voize AI, we‚Äôre transforming not only the healthcare industry, but also have the potential to create value in many other sectors ‚Äì from healthcare to inspections.

üí° Your Mission

If you're a Senior Machine Learning Engineer experienced with NLP and are excited to work at the cutting edge of product design, applied ML research, and MLOps, then go ahead and apply! With us, you'll build products with direct user feedback, train AI models with real data, and ship new features to production every day.

ü§ù Your Skillset ‚Äì What You Bring To The Table


Several years experience shipping models (LLMs) into production
Significant experience with deep learning frameworks (preferably PyTorch)
Proven capability training new models from scratch
Experience in speech recognition or NLP & transformer models (TTS, STT)
Engineering excellence with CI/CD for example Docker, Kubernetes
Nice to have: German language skills would be a bonus


üöÄ Your Daily Business ‚Äì No two days are alike


Take ownership for the design, training, evaluation, and deployment of our deep learning models in the space of speech recognition and NLP
The models you build and refine are at the heart of our applications and directly impact the end-user
You'll get to engineer large self-supervised trainings as well as fast inference for mobile devices and hosted environments


üéØ Our Success Mindset ‚Äì How we work at voize


Resilience is one of your strengths ‚Äì you see challenges as opportunities, not obstacles
Iterative working suits you ‚Äì you test, learn, and improve constantly instead of waiting for perfection
Communication & feedback come naturally to you ‚Äì you openly address issues and both give and receive constructive feedback


üå± Growing together ‚Äì what you can expect at voize


Become a co-creator of our success with virtual stock options
Our office is in Berlin, and we offer remote work
We provide flexible working hours because you know best when you work most efficiently!
Access to various learning platforms (e.g., Blinkist, Audible, etc.)
We have an open culture and organize regular work weeks and team events to collaborate and bond
We are a fast-growing startup, so you'll encounter various challenges, providing the perfect foundation for rapid personal growth
Your work will make a real impact, helping alleviate the workload for healthcare professionals
Free Germany Ticket and Urban Sports Club membership
30 days of vacation ‚Äì plus your birthday off


‚ú® Ready to talk? Apply now! üöÄ

We look forward to your application and can‚Äôt wait to meet you ‚Äì no matter who you are or what background you have!

Title: Scientist and Research Software Engineer (f/m/d) (Ref. 25/05)
Description:
The Weierstrass Institute for Applied Analysis and Stochastics (WIAS) is an institute of the Forschungsverbund Berlin e.V. (FVB). The FVB comprises seven non-university research institutes in Berlin which are funded by the federal and state governments. The research institutes belong to the Leibniz Association.

WIAS invites applications as

Scientist and Research Software Engineer (f/m/d)

(Ref. 25/05)

in the Research Group

‚ÄúNumerical Mathematics and Scientific ComputingNumerical Mathematics and Scientific Computing‚Äú

(Head: Prof. Dr. V. John) starting as soon as possible.

The work tasks include: active research in the topics of numerical simulations for problems from applications, especially those which are studied in the research group (e.g., in connection with fluid mechanics, biomedical applications, semiconductors or electro-chemistry). In addition, it is expected that the staff of the institute is supported in the development and publication of scientific software, e.g., by organizing appropriate qualification measures.

We are looking for: Applicants should have relevant scientific publications and experience in the development numerical methods for application-oriented problems, of the implementation of scientific software or open-source software and a good knowledge of modern software development methods, such as version control, continuous integration and documentation tools. The successful candidate is expected to support projects from the above mentioned applications in cooperation with partners inside and outside WIAS, to contribute to WIAS software development, and be willing to provide instruction and training to scientists (also in English).

A university diploma or master degree in mathematics or a closely related discipline as well as a PhD degree are required.

What we offer:


WIAS Berlin is a premier research institution known for its strength in optimization, optimal control, dynamical systems, and applied mathematics in general.
Mobile working
A certified (Audit berufundfamilie) family-friendly work environment.
Berlin is one of the most culture-rich and diverse international cities in the world. It offers endless opportunities to enjoy life outside work, while being very affordable compared to other major cities. Neither the job nor living in Berlin requires German language (although WIAS offers free German courses). We highly welcome international applications. Scientifically, Berlin offers a rich landscape with numerous opportunities for research, as well as job prospects in academia and industry.


Technical queries should be directed to Prof. Dr. V. John (john@wias-berlin).

The working hours are 39 hours per week and the position is remunerated according to TVoeD Bund and is initially limited to three years.

The Weierstra√ü Institute is an equal opportunity employer. We explicitly encourage female researchers to apply for the offered position. Among equally qualified applicants, disabled candidates will be given preference.

Please upload complete application documents including cover letter, curriculum vitae, certificates, and a copy of your Ph.D. thesis (or relevant publications) via our online job-application facility until April 30, 2025 using the button ‚ÄúApply online‚Äù.

We are looking forward to your application!

Der FVB ist Tr√§ger von sieben au√üeruniversit√§ren naturwissenschaftlichen Forschungsinstituten in Berlin, die von der Bundesrepublik Deutschland und der Gemeinschaft der L√§nder finanziert werden. Die Forschungsinstitute geh√∂ren der Leibniz-Gemeinschaft an.

(Leiter: Prof. Dr. Volker John) schnellstm√∂glich eine Stelle als

zu besetzen.

Die/der BewerberIn soll aktive Forschung auf den Gebieten der Simulation von Anwendungsthemen, insbesondere solchen, die in der Forschungsgruppe betrachtet werden (z.B. im Zusammenhang mit Str√∂mungen, biomedizinischen Anwendungen, Halbleitern oder Elektrochemie) betreiben. Zudem sollen die Mitarbeiter/innen des Instituts bei der Entwicklung und Publikation wissenschaftlicher Software unterst√ºtzt werden, z.B. durch die Organisation entsprechende Qualifikationsma√ünahmen.

Wir suchen: Es sollten einschl√§gige wissenschaftliche Publikationen und Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung numerischer Methoden f√ºr anwendungsorientierte Probleme sowie ihrer Implementierung in wissenschaftliche Software oder Open-Source-Software und gute Kenntnisse zu modernen Methoden der Softwareentwicklung, wie Versionskontrolle, Continuous Integration und Dokumentationswerkzeugen vorgewiesen werden k√∂nnen. Erwartet wird die Mitarbeit in Projekten aus o.g. Anwendungen in Kooperation mit Partnern innerhalb und au√üerhalb des WIAS, in der Software-Entwicklung des WIAS und die Bereitschaft zur Anleitung und Schulung von Wissenschaftler:innen (auch in englischer Sprache).

Ein Hochschulabschluss in Mathematik (Diplom oder Master) oder in einer eng verwandten Disziplin sowie eine abgeschlossene Promotion sind erforderlich.

Was wir bieten:


Das WIAS Berlin ist eine f√ºhrende Forschungseinrichtung, die f√ºr ihre St√§rken in Bereichen wie Mathematische Modellierung, Optimierung, dynamische Systeme und angewandte Mathematik im Allgemeinen bekannt ist.
Bezahlung nach dem Tarifvertrag f√ºr den √∂ffentlichen Dienst (TV√∂D Bund) einschlie√ülich der √ºblichen Sozialleistungen (30 Urlaubstage in der 5-Tage-Woche, betriebliche Altersvorsorge); Zuschuss zum Firmenticket f√ºr den √ñPNV
Mobiles Arbeiten
Ein zertifiziertes (Audit berufundfamilie) familienfreundliches Arbeitsumfeld.
Berlin bietet unendlich viele M√∂glichkeiten, das Leben au√üerhalb der Arbeit zu genie√üen. Weder f√ºr die Arbeit noch f√ºr das Leben in Berlin sind deutsche Sprachkenntnisse erforderlich (obwohl das WIAS kostenlose Deutschkurse anbietet). Internationale Bewerbungen sind uns sehr willkommen. In wissenschaftlicher Hinsicht bietet Berlin eine reichhaltige Landschaft mit zahlreichen M√∂glichkeiten f√ºr die Forschung sowie Jobperspektiven in Wissenschaft und Industrie.


Fachliche R√ºckfragen sind an Prof. Dr. Volker John (volker.john@wias-berlin.de) zu richten.

Die Stelle wird nach TV√∂D verg√ºtet wird und ist zun√§chst auf 3 Jahre befristet. Die Arbeitszeit betr√§gt insgesamt 39 Wochenstunden.

In Anbetracht der angestrebten Erh√∂hung des Frauenanteils im Wissenschaftsbereich sind Bewerbungen qualifizierter Interessentinnen besonders willkommen. Schwerbehinderte werden bei gleicher Qualifikation bevorzugt.

Bitte laden Sie Ihre vollst√§ndigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, Zeugnissen bis zum 30. April 2025 √ºber unser Bewerber-Portal hoch, indem Sie den Button ‚ÄûOnline bewerben‚Äú klicken.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer AI Automation (LLMs)
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG reimagined the relationship between music companies, songwriters, and artists by offering fairer contracts, greater creative freedom, and unparalleled transparency in royalties and licensing. Now the fourth-largest music company in the world, BMG combines human creativity with cutting-edge technology to connect music with global audiences.




We are looking for a ML-Engineer (f/m/d) to join our team and play a key role in developing AI-driven automation solutions that enhance efficiency and deliver high-performance results. As part of a dynamic and dedicated team of software and ML engineers, you will be responsible for designing, coding, and optimizing AI cloud-based services leveraging neural networks and LLMs into automation processes as well as taking part of the growing development of AI in BMG and the music industry.




If you're passionate about AI, LLMs, cloud-based services, and automation, and you want to contribute to the development of game-changing solutions, we would love to hear from you!




What you‚Äôll be doing

Design and develop scalable AI-driven automation solutions, ensuring they meet both current and future business needs
Collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, and data science teams to integrate AI models seamlessly into automation workflows
Ensure the creation of high-performance, robust, and maintainable software, adhering to best practices for software engineering and AI system design
Troubleshoot and optimize AI-powered automation systems, improving efficiency, accuracy, and reliability
Conduct thorough testing and validation of AI models and automation solutions to ensure they meet quality standards and perform consistently under various conditions
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, LLMs and automation technologies, integrating cutting-edge solutions to enhance system capabilities and drive innovation
Implement and challenge state-of-the-art neural networks and transformers through various research and development projects to rigorously evaluate their performance and deploy impactful AI solutions that transform the music industry




What you bring

5+ years of experience in ML, software engineering, or automation, with a proven ability to develop and deploy AI-driven solutions
Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field, with a solid foundation in software development, AI technologies and ML
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or other relevant languages commonly used in AI and automation development
Hands-on experience with APIs implementation and integrating ML models into production environments
Hands-on experience with ML models (DNN, DT, Transformers, LLMs) implementation, training/fine-tuning and evaluation in an R&D context
Scientific publications and experience conducting scientific research is a plus
Strong problem-solving abilities and a demonstrated capacity to collaborate effectively in agile teams, adapting to changing requirements and priorities¬¥
Experience with cloud platforms and deployment (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) is a plus, enabling efficient scaling of AI solutions
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders




What we offer

A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team




This is us

With 20 offices across 13 key markets, BMG represents more than three million songs and recordings, including some of the most iconic catalogs and works from leading artists and songwriters such as The Rolling Stones, Tina Turner, George Harrison, Blondie, and more. BMG is wholly owned and privately held by the international media, services, and education company Bertelsmann, whose other content businesses include the entertainment company RTL Group and the trade book publisher Penguin Random House.




As the great Kurt Cobain* once said, ‚ÄúCome as you are.‚Äù BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities and we celebrate diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity runs deep in our core value of fairness and we are determined to create a truly inclusive work environment, where everyone can flourish. If you‚Äôre good at what you do, come as you are.







All applicants to BMG will receive equal treatment regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital or civil parter status, pregnancy or maternity, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation.

(BMG is the proud representative of Kurt Cobain‚Äôs publishing catalogue, including the 1992 single ‚ÄòCome As You Are‚Äô)

Title: Associate Research Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for an Associate Research Scientist to help us accomplish our mission to improve and extend lives by learning from the experience of every person with cancer. Are you ready to be the next changemaker in cancer care?

Flatiron Health is a healthtech company using data for good to power smarter care for every person with cancer, around the world. Flatiron partners with cancer centers in the US, Europe and Asia to transform patients‚Äô real-life experiences into real-world evidence and create a more modern, connected oncology ecosystem. Our multidisciplinary teams include oncologists, data scientists, software engineers, epidemiologists, product experts and more. Flatiron Health is an independent affiliate of the Roche Group.

What You'll Do

In this role, you will work as a member of the Research Sciences (RS) department, primarily supporting our work in the UK, Germany, and Japan. This team provides customized real-world data and real-world evidence solutions to address the most important research questions across clinical development, market access, and commercial use cases for our life sciences partners.

In this role, you will:



Develop subject matter expertise in real-world oncology data to support data product development and evidence generation.
Design and conduct in-depth analyses to assess data quality and fitness-for-use for real-world evidence generation in the international markets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including epidemiologists, data scientists, and oncologists, to refine methodologies and ensure rigorous study execution.
Implement statistical analyses by translating analytic specifications from a statistical analysis plan into R code to generate descriptive and inferential statistics and develop visualizations.
Contribute to external scientific publications, including manuscripts and conference abstracts, to advance the field of oncology real-world evidence.
Stay current with epidemiological and statistical methodologies for analyzing observational real-world data and deepen expertise in cancer biology, therapies, and outcomes across multiple tumor types.



Who You Are

You're a kind, passionate and collaborative problem-solver who values the opportunity to think beyond the way things are. In addition, you‚Äôre an analytical thinker and excellent communicator with experience or interest in supporting design and execution of real-world studies that support use cases across the oncology product development life cycle. You are excited by the prospect of rolling up your sleeves to tackle meaningful problems each and every day. Additionally:



You hold a Master‚Äôs degree in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Health Economics and Outcomes Research, Health Policy (or closely related field) with 2 - 3 years of relevant professional experience, or a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in one of those fields with 4-5 years of relevant professional experience
You have experience working in a pharmaceutical, HEOR consulting, healthcare analytics, or academic research environment
You have experience with observational datasets (e.g., registries, healthcare claims, or electronic health records)
You‚Äôre proficient at coding in R
You have strong communication skills, with experience contributing to study documentation
You have effective organizational, time-management, and prioritization and skills necessary to contribute to multiple high-visibility projects in a timely fashion
You have an agile mindset and adapt quickly to changes in project direction
You are able to quickly learn and apply new information, skills and procedures
You are passionate about our mission to improve healthcare through technology



Optional



You have oncology experience
You are fluent in German



Who We Are

Our people are at the centre of everything we do. We strive to foster a culture where our teammates feel equipped and empowered to make meaningful contributions with confidence, compassion, and clarity.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer ( Consumer - Global Recommendations & AI - Machine Learning Platform )
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Machine Learning Engineer to join the Consumer - Global Recommendations & AI - Machine Learning Platform tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

Are you ready to take your Machine Learning Engineering skills to the next level and make a tangible impact on millions of users worldwide? We're seeking a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join our innovative Global Machine Learning Platform team. Our mission is to empower Data Science teams across Delivery Hero's diverse brands (Foodora, Foodpanda, Glovo, Talabat, Peya, Hungerstation, Woowa, and more) with a cutting-edge, scalable platform. This platform enables them to rapidly and reliably develop, deploy, and manage machine learning models that drive personalized experiences for our global customer base.

In this role you will,


Build the infrastructure that powers personalized experiences for millions of customers across the globe, every single day.
Design , build and maintain a scalable ML infrastructure to manage the entire ML lifecycle at scale.
Develop Tooling: Build and enhance ML engineering tooling for Model Development, Model Workbench, Model Training, Model monitoring, and Model serving.
Collaborate and Optimize: Work closely with data scientists and data engineers to understand their needs and build solutions that optimize their workflows.
Leverage Cloud: Utilize modern technologies and public cloud infrastructure to build highly available systems for multiple teams.
Scale and Perform: Build solutions at scale, optimizing for performance and efficiency.
Address Pain Points: Understand the pain points of application teams and translate them into robust platform features.
Innovate and Suggest: Proactively suggest how the team can leverage new technologies and architectures to support new use cases.


What you need to be successful


Software Engineering Expertise: At least 4 years of experience in software engineering with hands-on experience with modern programming languages such as Python, Java, or Golang.
Technical Evaluation: Experience in tech explorations to evaluate technologies for business problems and proposing solutions based on comprehensive pros and cons analysis.
Proof of Concept: Prior experience building proof of concepts for solving system design challenges using open-source tools.
Application Development: Experience building new applications from scratch.
System Analysis: Experience in deep-diving into existing systems for investigations and improvements.
ML Engineering Experience: Prior experience in ML engineering or MLOps.
Communication Skills: Fluency in English. Clarity in communication, both written and verbal.


Nice to Have


Prior knowledge of public cloud platforms (Google Cloud or equivalent).
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as Code (Terraform or equivalent).
Familiarity with the ML engineering ecosystem, such as Model serving, training, and feature engineering pipelines.
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools like Docker, Kubernetes, and Helm.
Experience with ML tools like Metaflow, MLflow, Argo Workflows, and Cloud Notebooks.


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer

Location: Berlin/Hybrid




We are seeking a talented and driven AI Engineer to join fast-growing AI start-up, REMATIQ. This is an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI solutions that are transforming regulatory affairs. As an AI Engineer, you will take ownership of designing, building, and scaling machine learning systems that drive impactful innovation in the industry.




Responsibilities

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy machine learning models into production.
Build and optimize scalable and efficient machine learning pipelines for data processing, model training, and deployment.
Lead efforts in identifying, implementing, and validating the best algorithms and techniques for solving business challenges.
Take ownership of model performance, monitoring, and continuous improvement in production.
Mentor junior team members and contribute to fostering a collaborative engineering culture.
Research and stay up-to-date on advancements in machine learning, MLOps, and related technologies.
Contribute to the development of best practices in model lifecycle management, including reproducibility and version control.




Requirements

Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or AI Engineer in a similar role, with expertise in Python.Strong track record of delivering production-grade machine learning systems, including model deployment and monitoring.
Proficiency in at least one of the following areas:
Data Science: Advanced analytics, statistical modeling, and insights generation.
MLOps: Building robust CI/CD pipelines for machine learning workflows and automation.
Large Language Models (LLMs): Fine-tuning, training, or deploying state-of-the-art transformer-based models.Natural Language Processing (NLP): Developing applications like text classification, summarization, or entity recognition.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with scalable data storage and processing systems (e.g., Spark, Hadoop, or similar).
Passion for leveraging AI to revolutionize regulatory affairs.




Nice-to-Have Skills

Experience working in an early-stage start-up
Familiarity with regulatory affairs or compliance-related applications.
Contributions to open-source machine learning projects.
Expertise in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Strong software engineering practices, including code reviews, testing, and documentation.




Why Join Us?

Innovative Mission: Be part of transforming regulatory affairs with cutting-edge AI technology.

Impactful Role: Take ownership of significant projects and contribute to shaping the future of the industry.

Collaborative Environment: Work with a small, ambitious team where everyone has real ownership over the product and company.

Growth Opportunities: Learn and grow in a fast-paced start-up environment with continuous professional development.

Compensation: Competitive salary and a generous equity package for early employees..




Join REMATIQ and be a driving force in revolutionizing regulatory affairs through AI. If you are a passionate and skilled AI Engineer ready to make an impact, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Erste Praxiserfahrung in der Anwendung von Prinzipien des Software-Engineerings und in den DevOps- / MLOps-Prinzipien und -Tools
Kenntnisse in mindestens einer analytischen Programmiersprache (z.B. Python, R) oder einer universellen Programmiersprache (z.B. C#, Java, C++, Rust)
Kenntnisse in der Nutzung relationaler und nicht-relationaler Datenbanken
Ausgepr√§gte Kommunikationsst√§rke in Deutsch und Englisch - im Team und Kunden gegen√ºber
Neugier und Bereitschaft zu gelegentlichen Reisen


Von Vorteil:


Berufserfahrung im Bereich Software Engineering, Data Science oder Business Intelligence oder als Berater im Digitalisierungskontext
Erfahrungen mit Cloud-Technologien (z.B. Azure, AWS), Big-Data-Technologien (z.B. Spark, Kafka) sowie Containerisierung (z.B. Docker, Kubernetes)


Wir bieten alle Rahmenbedingungen, um sich in diese Themen effizient einzuarbeiten, falls Sie dieses Wissen nicht mitbringen.

Das bieten wir Ihnen

Mensch & Kultur: Die Gemeinschaft und der Austausch im Unternehmen werden durch vielf√§ltige Events wie Unternehmensmittagessen, Sommerfeste, Teamevents, Unternehmenskonferenzen und Weihnachtsfeiern aktiv gef√∂rdert. Ein Welcome Day sowie ein Mentoren-Programm w√§hrend der Einarbeitungszeit tragen zudem dazu bei, den Zusammenhalt innerhalb der Teams zu st√§rken. Zus√§tzlich f√∂rdern wir den Teamgeist durch eine substanzielle Gewinnbeteiligung, die auf alle Mitarbeiter verteilt wird.

Karriereentwicklung & Wissensaustausch: Die Vielfalt unserer (Kunden-)Projekte erm√∂glicht eine individuelle Karriereentwicklung. Verschiedenste Schulungsangebote und die Teilnahme an Fachkonferenzen f√∂rdern fachliches Wachstum. Ein j√§hrliches Wissensbudget von 12 Tagen und Wissenszirkel unterst√ºtzen den kontinuierlichen Wissensaustausch.

Work-Life-Balance & Flexibilit√§t: Flexible Arbeitszeiten mit Arbeitszeitkonto, Mobile Office/hybrides Arbeiten, Workation-/Sabbatical-Optionen und die M√∂glichkeit Hunde mit ins B√ºro zu bringen, sind nur ein Teil unseres Angebots f√ºr Flexibilit√§t und Lebensqualit√§t. Auch in kritischen Situationen unterst√ºtzen wir mit bis zu 5 bezahlten Abwesenheitstagen, um sich um pflegebed√ºrftige oder kranke Familienmitglieder zu k√ºmmern.

Finanzielle Vorteile: Mitarbeiter profitieren von unseren Zusch√ºssen f√ºr: Kinderbetreuung, Essen und Sport, betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit unverbindlicher Beratung, Deutschlandticket f√ºr nachhaltiges Reisen.

Gesundheit & Wohlbefinden: Verschiedene Gesundheitsma√ünahmen wie bewegte Pausen, Ergonomieberatung, Grippeimpfung und Augenarztuntersuchung f√∂rdern das Wohlbefinden und die langfristige Gesundheit der Mitarbeiter. Gesunde Snacks und Getr√§nke geh√∂ren selbstverst√§ndlich ebenfalls zu unserem Angebot. Und um auch die soziale Interaktion zu st√§rken, haben wir Hobby- und Sportgruppen etabliert, welche nicht nur den lockeren Austausch, sondern auch den Zusammenhalt im Team st√§rken.

Soziale Verantwortung & Nachhaltigkeit: Durch die HuManS-Stiftung streben wir danach, einen positiven Beitrag zur Gesellschaft zu leisten. Unsere Klimainitiative und das Umweltprogramm setzen sich engagiert f√ºr nachhaltige Unternehmenspraktiken ein.

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung als Data Scientist (mwd) in Voll- oder Teilzeit (mind. 80%)!

Title: Data Scientist - Consumer (Global Discovery)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Scientist to join the Search & Ranking team within consumer discovery on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.


Develop and Optimize Search Algorithms: Enhance and research new search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization, to deliver the most relevant results to our users.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work as part of a cross-functional team, including Backend Engineers, Product Managers, and Data Engineers, to improve our global search end-2-end.
Analyze and interpret large datasets: Extract meaningful insights to understand relevance problems.
Innovate and Experiment: Identify and apply the best machine learning and statistical methods to solve complex problems, ensuring solutions are scalable and effective in production environments.
Navigate Ambiguity: Define and tackle data science problems amidst ambiguity, ensuring clear problem definitions and actionable insights


At Delivery Hero, you‚Äôll shape the global consumer experience for millions of users. Your work will have a direct impact on how we attract and retain customers, creating data-driven, personalized interactions that keep them coming back. As part of our Consumer Team, you‚Äôll enhance customer satisfaction and drive global growth and profitability through innovative projects.

What you need to be successful


Experience: Master‚Äôs degree (or Bachelor‚Äôs with 4+ years of work experience) in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Theoretical Chemistry, or similar. 2+ years of experience as a data scientist working on applying data science fundamentals to solve complex business problems
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in SQL and Python and its ML ecosystem is essential. Experience with Java and Scala is a plus.
Machine Learning Knowledge: Strong understanding of a wide variety of ML and statistical methods, including Classical ML, Deep Learning, NLP, and Recommendation Systems. Ability to discern the most suitable approach for different problems.
Search and Ranking ML Algorithms: Hands-on experience with search machine learning algorithms, such as learning to rank, semantic search, and personalization.
Problem-Solving: Comfortable with ambiguity and capable of navigating it to define clear data science problems and solutions. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering practical solutions.
Collaborative Spirit: Proven experience working in cross-functional teams, contributing effectively to joint projects and achieving common goals. Excellent communication skills to articulate complex ideas and influence stakeholders.


Who we are

As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Machine Learning Engineering Lead (m/f/d) - Berlin
Description:
Location: We are flexible! Come and join us either in Hamburg, Berlin, Athens or Barcelona.

The Marketplace department is the core of our platform and consists of Product Management, Data and Engineering. Together as a team we are going to build our Pricing product, which leads to higher customer engagement, better supply utilisation, and ultimately to a balanced demand and supply situation.

As the Machine Learning Engineering Lead in the Marketplace, you will work closely with the Product and Engineering Managers to improve the existing products such as surge or demand prediction, and evaluate future opportunities to improve our Marketplace performance. You're responsible for a team of 4 to 6 Machine Learning Engineers, being-hands on in mentoring them to help and grow, and responsible for the data strategy of Marketplace along with the Data Science Lead, ensuring high quality of our data products.

If you want to help unveil new potential and move FREENOW in a much stronger position, here is your chance. In more detail this means‚Ä¶

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURES WILL INCLUDE:


Being hands-on and mentoring the MLEs to grow and improve the architecture, reliability and monitoring of our systems while being their line manager, as well as being the hiring manager for the role.
In close collaboration within the data science lead and engineering managers, set the right priorities for their teams, conceptualise and implement various components of the ML engineering infrastructure and processes to maximise the impact and value of data usage for all stakeholders in our increasingly complex market environment.
Facilitating effective collaboration between product managers, data scientists, machine learning engineers, data engineers and cross-functional engineering teams.
By using strategic thinking, business understanding and being informed on the latest developments in MLE, help the team to identify, understand, structure and solve complex problems and improve and productionize real-time data products.
Being the advocate for MLEs in the business and improving the speed and quality of delivery.


Our Datastack: Python | MLFlow | Databricks | Presto/Trino | Tableau | Airflow | Metabase & more

TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE:

You are a problem solver, detail-oriented and self-motivated individual who thrives in an innovative, highly motivated environment, combining technical, product, business and leadership perspectives. Further key aspects of your profile are:


You like being a hands-on leader and being deep in the code but also know when to effectively delegate and help your direct reports grow in their careers
Excellent communication skills and capable of interacting and coordinating with internal and external stakeholders in steering end-to-end processes and projects
Experience leading and developing top performing data teams and collaboration with cross-functional engineering teams
Facilitating ways of working between Machine Learning engineers, Data Engineers and Data Scientists
A history of leading and supporting successful data projects and the ability to define project objectives, resources, timelines and methodologies clearly to all stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to thrive in a fast paced and collaborative environment
Act as a role model in pragmatism to find solutions for your team


BENEFITS & PERKS IN A NUTSHELL:

Flexible working arrangements

LinkedIn Learning

Sabbatical & special leave policies
